ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Has there been a change in the last several years caused by cognitive (thinking and memory) problems? Problems with judgment (e.g. falls for scams, bad financial decisions, buys gifts inappropriate for recipients)
Notes: 0= No, no change; 1= Yes, a change; 99= N/A, do not know

ElementDescription: Has there been a change in the last several years caused by cognitive (thinking and memory) problems? Reduced interest in hobbies/activities
Notes: 0= No, no change; 1= Yes, a change; 99= N/A, do not know

ElementDescription: Has there been a change in the last several years caused by cognitive (thinking and memory) problems? Repeats questions, stories or statements
Notes: 0= No, no change; 1= Yes, a change; 99= N/A, do not know

ElementDescription: Has there been a change in the last several years caused by cognitive (thinking and memory) problems? Trouble learning how to use a tool, appliance or gadget (e.g. VCR, computer, microwave, remote control)
Notes: 0= No, no change; 1= Yes, a change; 99= N/A, do not know

ElementDescription: Has there been a change in the last several years caused by cognitive (thinking and memory) problems? Forgets correct month or year
Notes: 0= No, no change; 1= Yes, a change; 99= N/A, do not know

ElementDescription: Has there been a change in the last several years caused by cognitive (thinking and memory) problems? Difficulty handling complicated financial affairs (e.g. balancing checkbook, income taxes, paying bills)
Notes: 0= No, no change; 1= Yes, a change; 99= N/A, do not know

ElementDescription: Has there been a change in the last several years caused by cognitive (thinking and memory) problems? Difficulty remembering appointments
Notes: 0= No, no change; 1= Yes, a change; 99= N/A, do not know

ElementDescription: Has there been a change in the last several years caused by cognitive (thinking and memory) problems? Consistent problems with thinking and/or memory
Notes: 0= No, no change; 1= Yes, a change; 99= N/A, do not know

ElementDescription: AD8 Alzheimer Disease Screener - Total Score
Notes: Number of items ad8_1-8 endorsed ''Yes, a change''

ElementDescription: On average in the past 6-months has your relative with dementia had any of the following problems? Experienced problems with judgement?  (e.g. falls for scams, bad financial decision, buys gifts that are inappropriate for recipients)
On average in the past 6-months has your relative with dementia had any of the following problems? A reduced interest in hobbies or activities?
On average in the past 6-months has your relative with dementia had any of the following problems? Repeated questions, stories, or statements?

On average in the past 6-months has your relative with dementia had any of the following problems? Had trouble learning how to use a tool, appliance, or gadget?   (e.g. computer, microwave, remote controls)
On average in the past 6-months has your relative with dementia had any of the following problems? Often forgot the month or year?

On average in the past 6-months has your relative with dementia had any of the following problems? Had trouble handling complicated financial affairs?   (e.g. balancing checkbook, income taxes, paying bills)
On average in the past 6-months has your relative with dementia had any of the following problems? Had trouble remembering appointments?
On average in the past 6-months has your relative with dementia had any of the following problems? Had daily problems with thinking and/or memory?
